findings.Description: GitHub Action is not pinned to a specific SHA commit, which may lead to supply chain attacks
findings.Remediation: Pin the action to a full 40-character commit SHA instead of a version tag or branch reference. Example: uses: actions/checkout@a12a3943b4bdde767164f792f33f40b04645d846

findings.Description: Unquoted variable usage may lead to word splitting and pathname expansion
findings.Evidence:
for file in ${{ steps.changed-files.outputs.all_changed_files }}; do
  echo "$file was changed"
done
findings.Remediation: Quote variables: "$VAR" instead of $VAR

findings.Description: GitHub Action is not pinned to a specific SHA commit, which may lead to supply chain attacks
findings.Remediation: Pin the action to a full 40-character commit SHA instead of a version tag or branch reference. Example: uses: actions/checkout@a12a3943b4bdde767164f792f33f40b04645d846

findings.Description: Action is from an untrusted or unknown publisher
findings.Remediation: Verify the action is from a trusted source and consider pinning to a specific SHA

findings.Remediation: Review trigger necessity and add appropriate security controls

findings.Description: Unquoted variable usage may lead to word splitting and pathname expansion
findings.StepName: Extract and use GCP private key
findings.Evidence:
# Extracting the private key from the GCP service account key
PRIVATE_KEY=$(echo $GCP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY | jq -r '.private_key')

# Simulate using the private key
echo "Using the private key for some operation"

# Log the private key (simulating a mistake)
echo "GCP Private Key: $PRIVATE_KEY"
findings.Remediation: Quote variables: "$VAR" instead of $VAR
